challenges: No direct permit search - must search by address first
Permits are nested under addresses with expand/collapse UI
Interactive JavaScript interface may require careful navigation
Login required for "Create Account" but NOT for public lookup

steps: 1. Obtain list of addresses in Westlake (from county records or other source)
2. For each address, query the lookup endpoint
3. Expand address details to find permit count
4. If permits exist, expand permits section
5. Extract permit details (IDs, types, dates, etc.)
scraping_strategy.alternative: May have API endpoints that return permit data directly - investigate network tab
scraping_strategy.difficulty: Medium - requires address list and multi-step navigation

test_results.permits_visible: Collapsed by default, requires click to expand

notes: Initial assessment marked as BLOCKED due to login wall on main page
Further investigation found Address Lookup feature is publicly accessible
Permits (3) shown for test address - data exists and is public
Platform is MyGov - same as Rowlett/Grapevine but Westlake ALLOWS public access
This contradicts initial assumption that all MyGov portals block public access
priority: HIGH - User indicated this is high-value
